text: Entrance of palace of Kuthar Princely State, Himachal Pradesh, India Palace of erstwhile Princely State Kuthar, Himachal Pradesh, India Kuthar was a princely state of the British Raj, located in modern-day Himachal Pradesh. It was one of the several states of the Punjab States Agency. The state of Kuthar was founded in the 17th century. It was occupied by Nepali forces during drive of himalayas from 1803 to 1815. The rulers of the state used the title of 'Rana'. ==Rulers== The rulers bore the title of Rana. * 1803 - Gopal Singh * 1815 - 1858 Bhup Singh * 1858 - 1896 Jai Chand * 1896 - 1930 Jagjit Chand * 1930 - 15 Aug 1947 Krishna Chand (b. 1905) ==Gallery== File:A view 0f palace of Kuthar Princely State,Himachal Prades,India.jpg|A view 0f palace File:Wall painting ,Kuthar palace,Himachal Prades,India.jpg|Wall painting, Kuthar palace File:Architect of and art work of palace of Kuthar Princely State,Himachal Prades,India.jpg|Architect of and art work of palace of Kuthar File:Art work on enterence of palace of Kuthar Princely State,Himachal Prades,India.jpg|Art work on entrance of palace of Kuthar File:Art work on outer walls of palace of Kuthar Princely State,Himachal Prades,India.jpg|Art work on outer walls of palace of Kuthar File:Interior wall paintings on palace of Kuthar Princely State,Himachal Prades,India.jpg|Interior wall paintings on palace of Kuthar File:Interior art work on roof of Kuthar palace, Himachal Prades, India.jpg|Interior art work on roof of Kuthar palace ==See also== http://www.worldstatesmen.org/India_princes_K-W.html ==References== *http://rulers.org/indstat2.html Category:Agencies of British India Category:Princely states of Himachal Pradesh Category:Historical Indian regions Category:Princely states of India
